sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Emily Carter is being referred to the Rheumatology department for evaluation and management of persistent joint pain and swelling, which has not responded adequately to initial therapy. Further specialist input is requested to determine an underlying inflammatory or autoimmune process.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports a six-month history of intermittent pain and swelling in her hands and wrists, particularly affecting the morning hours with stiffness lasting over an hour. She also describes occasional low-grade fevers and increased fatigue. Over-the-counter NSAIDs have provided only partial relief. No significant trauma or recent infections have been reported.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: Ms. Carter has a history of mild seasonal allergies and hypothyroidism, currently managed with levothyroxine. There is no known history of autoimmune disease in her family. No previous surgeries or hospitalizations.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Levothyroxine 75 mcg daily, ibuprofen as needed for pain.

sections.heading: Assessment
sections.content: Persistent polyarticular joint pain and swelling, suspicious for early inflammatory arthritis. Laboratory workup reveals mildly elevated ESR and CRP, negative rheumatoid factor, and negative ANA. X-rays of the hands and wrists show no erosive changes.

sections.heading: Plan
sections.content: Referral to Rheumatology for further evaluation and possible initiation of disease-modifying therapy. Recommend continued use of NSAIDs as needed, monitor for worsening symptoms, and follow up after specialist review. All relevant laboratory and imaging results have been attached.
